description: Equal to the sum of its digits raised to its digits power (with the convention that 0^0=0).
comments: Sometimes called Munchhausen numbers. Cf. A166623.
references: J. S. Madachy, "Madachy's Mathematical Recreations", Dover N.Y., pp. 163-175.
C. A. Pickover, "Keys to Infinity", Wiley 1995, Ch. 22, pp. 169-171.
David Wells, "Curious and Interesting Numbers", Penguin 1988, pp. 169, 190.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Münchhausen Number.
author: _Patrick De Geest_, May 15 1998
